you mean absolutely no gui loaded?: well you may be better off installing something that by default has no gui, which will obviously boot to terminal
hmm, well i'd like the ability to load the gui, but don't use it that much on this virtual machine
I'm not exactly sure what you use it for, but my friend has just installed gentoo, and installed xcfe, but he automatically boots to command line
you could just change the tty, but trying to use the key combination under ubuntu will change the host computers tty
tty's aren't emulators, they are *like* exclusive sessions
if you press ctrl+alt+f[n] it will take you to a different tty, and ctrl+alt+f7 will take you back to the gui
ahh smart, i forgot about those function switches
i ended up just unchecking gdm from the system > admin > services, but that works too
